instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SSD_RESET_CONN_L: What is SSD_RESET_CONN_L? SSD_RESET_CONN_L is a signal that goes to the SSD that will put it in RESET mode which will keep it from working, when SSD_RESET_L is present. _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
the board looks fine but it doesn't read SSD on <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> pin <SIGNAL>P3V3SSD_VNOM</SIGNAL> is 0.9v I replaced the <RESISTOR>R3741</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R3742</RESISTOR> all the other pins are fine I get 3.1v.
any suggestions?

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P3V3SSD_VNOM</SIGNAL> is 0.9v"
That voltage is correct; calculate <RESISTOR>R3741</RESISTOR>/42 divider...

Post <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_CLQREQ_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
I got trolled today with an early 2013 retina not seeing ssd, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> 3.3v was showing at both side of L3700.
But L3700 was high resistance, pratically no current flow. Replace and everything ok.
So check L700 jus in case.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SSD_CLQREQ_L</SIGNAL> = 3.42"
It is bad...

Post all voltages for <CHIP>U3740</CHIP>.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
pin 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>= 3.4
pin 2 <SIGNAL>P3V3SSD_VMON</SIGNAL>= 0.98
pin 3 <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4
pin 4 <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4
pin 5 GRD
pin 6 <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 3,2
pin 7 <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL>= 3,2
pin 8SSD_CLKREQ_= 3,2

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
"pin 7 <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL>= 3,2"
Try another SSD and check SSD connector and trace for clock request.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
when SSD is connected to the board pin 7 and 8 get 0v but when I take the ssd out they get 3.2v.
Checked the trace and connectors as well.
Could it be a bad CPU?

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
when SSD is connected to the board pin 7 and 8 get 0v but when I take the ssd out they get 3.2v.
Checked the trace and connectors as well.
Could it be a bad CPU?

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message:
I was supposing you measure with SSD connected...
Why would I want to know voltages without SSD???

Check connection between J3700 and <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11.
Check <RESISTOR>R3710</RESISTOR> and all C371x capacitors.

Boot on USB OSX and look if onboard SSD appears into Disk Utility; maybe is not partitioned...

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message: I did boot on external HDD and onboard SSD appears into Disk Utility.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message: Try other SSD (with OSX), before formating and reinstalling the original.

threads.title: 820-000165 No SSD
threads.message: an other known working ssd with OSX shows the folder with question mark only when I boot with external HDD I can see the onboard sdd but from the SSD doesn't work
